page.title: 09SOUTH END SCHOOLS
page.content: The building which opened its doors for the first pupils in January 1878 was originally 3 separate schools catering for about 500 pupils in total South End Infants School was for children from about the age of 4 years to 7 or 8. The children then trans- ferred to either the Boys School or the Girls School where they stayed until they achieved the correct grade, often 5 years. The school was supervised by the Elland cum Greetland School Board of which there were 7 local members. There was little change until the second world war when many evacuees were received from the Ealing area swelling the school population so that as many as 6 or 7 children were sitting at a long desk.
